net.sf.jsptest.assertion

Class FormAssertion

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sf.jsptest.assertion.FormAssertion

  • public class FormAssertion
extends Object
    Provides form-related assertion methods.
    Author:
    Lasse Koskela

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      FormAssertion(Document document, ElementChooser chooser) 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      FormFieldAssertion field(String fieldName)
      Gives access to form field-specific assertions such as: form("name").field("name").shouldHaveValue("foo");
      void shouldHaveField(String name)
      Assert that the form has a field by the given name.
      void shouldHaveSubmitButton()
      Assert that the form has a submit button.
      void shouldHaveSubmitButton(String nameOrLabel)
      Assert that the form has a submit button by the given name or label.

    • Constructor Detail

      • FormAssertion

        public FormAssertion(Document document,
             ElementChooser chooser)
        Parameters:
        document - The context from where to select the form as the context for subsequent assertion methods.
        chooser - The ElementChooser to use for selecting the form.

    • Method Detail

      • shouldHaveField

        public void shouldHaveField(String name)
        Assert that the form has a field by the given name.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the expected form field.

      • shouldHaveSubmitButton

        public void shouldHaveSubmitButton(String nameOrLabel)
        Assert that the form has a submit button by the given name or label.
        Parameters:
        nameOrLabel - The name or label of the expected submit button.

      • shouldHaveSubmitButton

        public void shouldHaveSubmitButton()
        Assert that the form has a submit button.

      • field

        public FormFieldAssertion field(String fieldName)
        Gives access to form field-specific assertions such as: form("name").field("name").shouldHaveValue("foo");
        Parameters:
        fieldName - The name of the field.
